Note: In the beginning of the protocol we had to switch the devices from the ones we placed for pre questions.
The out of the box experience took about 10 minutes rather than the 45 minutes the was ask.
During prof all the participant is noticing that the display is very light so they have to be looking at a dark display.
The participant is navigating through the game very well, one thing that could change would be that the not all hand movements are not registering all movements.
Once we moved around the room, pertinent noticed a more difficult time seeing the visuals due to the light reflecting and lack of dark background.
Participant doesn’t automatically recognize that hand can be in any position.
Dark objects are easier to utilize to focus on the UX.
Difference in hand movement pattern is taking a second for the haptics to recognize.
Motion capture is accurate 4 out of 5 times. More issues emerge as user tries to experiment.
Horizontal motion capture doesn’t feel as accurate as the vertical motion.
During the protocol participant was noticing that the up and down movements were registering easier then side to side.
As far and display sized participant is noting that the display is a good size for activity.
At the 45 minutes mark we switched positions and in this new position there was a higher amount of glare.
At the 47 minutes mark participant noticed a slight bit of discomfort in constant hand movement.
At the 52min mark the screen shut down on its own. Participants had to wake it up.
At the 53 minutes mark we noticed that screen timed out once again.
Screen fell asleep after two minutes after the last Random shut down.
Shutdown reporter 3.5 minutes after last spontaneous shut-down
There was a technical difficulty that has caused for me to miss a prompt.
In the beginning of the what’s app chat there was a problem with connecting the glasses with WhatsApp.
During the video call, the participant really enjoyed the experience
